definition: straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God

sentences.english: Five of the new seats will be directly elected, representing geographical constituencies.
sentences.chinese: 新增加席位中有五人来自直选，分别代表各个选区。

sentences.english: We hope to get 25 seats from five geographical constituencies.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望在地区直选的五个地区里获得二十五席。

sentences.english: Direct election was carried out in the Communist Party committees of 363 neighborhoods in Nanjing.
sentences.chinese: 南京363个社区以公推直选方式选党委书记。

sentences.english: The third chapter the villages and towns party committee management chooses by acclamation the direct election reality to realize the way.
sentences.chinese: 第三章乡镇党委领导班子公推直选现实的实现途径。

sentences.english: The fourth chapter the villages and towns party committee management chooses by acclamation the direct election the theory innovation value.
sentences.chinese: 第四章乡镇党委领导班子公推直选的宪法实践创新。

sentences.english: The issue of how to transition toward direct elections is contentious.
sentences.chinese: 如何向直选过渡的议题很容易引来争吵。

definition: the hundreds place (or column) in the decimal system
to continue in (a political) office/to serve for another term of office
to throw one's energies (into an activity)/to invest one's emotions (in sth)/to bet/betting
to try to answer a question (in a quiz, guessing game, riddle etc)/quiz game
